author: Aaron Seigo
message:
a-HA! awesome sleuthing ... and a great tutorial on a very hidden "gotcha" with deleteLater().

thanks for the fix!

author: Jason
message: Why is that a nicer fix? Why exactly prefer deleteLater over a more straight-forward delete in this situation?

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: While it's true delete would work just as well here, fixing it in libindicate-qt is nicer because the bug is specific to this library: other code using libindicate-qt could potentially suffer from the same problem.

author: Alex
message: This bug was really annoying me. Thanks a bunch for fixing it!

author: Kevin Krammer
message:
Wouldn't it be better, especially considering futurre work, to to not wrap a wrapper but directly implement the D-Bus interfaces?

You not only have more control over the D-Bus facing code, you also avoid unnecessary conversions (D-Bus type -> C type -> Qt type vs.D-Bus type -> Qt type )

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: I agree. This is the reason I went for a "pure" Qt implementation with dbusmenu-qt rather than wrapping dbusmenu-glib (that and ensuring the spec was complete and without gray area). There is some work planned to address this, stay tuned.
